section.heading: Residential parking system in the village of Dobbs Ferry in the county of Westchester

content.p: Oak street, from Broadway to Main street;\n
Elm street, from Broadway to Main street;\n
Chestnut street, from Broadway to Main street;\n
Walnut street, from Broadway to Livingston avenue;\n
Hatch terrace, from Broadway to Walnut street;\n
Palisade street, from Cedar street to Chestnut street;\n
Cedar street, from Main street to a point 750 feet west of\nPalisade street;\n

The portion of Draper lane owned by the village of Dobbs Ferry.
 3. Notwithstanding the foregoing, no permit shall be required on those
portions of such streets where the adjacent properties are zoned for
commercial, office and/or retail use.
 4. The local law or ordinance providing for such residential parking
system shall:
set forth factors necessitating the enactment of such parking\nsystem;\n
provide the times of the day and days of the week during which\npermit requirements shall be in effect;\n
provide the schedule of fees to be paid for such permits; and\n

provide that such fees shall be credited to the general fund of
the village of Dobbs Ferry unless otherwise specified in such local law.
 5. No ordinance shall be adopted pursuant to this section until a
public hearing thereon has been had in the same manner as required for
public hearings on a local law pursuant to the municipal home rule law.
 6. The provisions of this section shall not apply to any state highway
maintained by the state.
